text: Jozef Tomko (11 March 1924 - 8 August 2022) was a Slovak Cardinal of the Roman Catholic Church. He was Prefect of the Congregation for the Evangelization of Peoples from 1985 to 2001, and was elevated to the cardinalate in 1985."Tomko, Jozef", Catholic News Agency Tomko became the oldest living member of the College of Cardinals in July 2021, after the death of Albert Vanhoye. Tomko died on 8 August 2022 from problems caused by a fall in Rome, Italy at the age of 98.Zomrel kardinál Jozef Tomko, patril k najvplyvnejším ľuďom vo Vatikáne ==References== Category:1924 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Cardinals of the Roman Catholic Church Category:Slovak people Category:Accidental deaths from falls
title: Jozef Tomko
